questions.question: Which protocol is used to send sensor data to IoT platforms in this experiment?

explanations.a: MQTT is a lightweight messaging protocol, but HTTP is used for data transfer in this case.
explanations.b: HTTP is the protocol used to send sensor data to IoT platforms in this experiment.
explanations.c: TCP is a transport layer protocol, not typically used for IoT data transfer directly.
explanations.d: FTP is used for file transfers, not for sending live data in IoT applications.

questions.question: What is the role of the ESP8266/ESP32 in this experiment?

answers.b: To connect to the IoT platform and send the data

explanations.a: The ESP8266/ESP32 does not process data; it sends it to the IoT platform.
explanations.b: The ESP8266/ESP32 connects to the internet and sends sensor data to the cloud platform using HTTP.
explanations.c: The ESP8266/ESP32 powers the sensors through its GPIO pins, but it doesn't store data locally.
explanations.d: The ESP8266/ESP32 does not store data locally; it sends it to the cloud for remote access.
